intro: Herpetospermum, commonly known as the "snake seed" plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, often clustered flowers and woody stems. The genus includes several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. Herpetospermum plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, fleshy fruits. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
